introduction.title: Discovering Sri Lanka's Wildlife Wonders
introduction.description: Sri Lanka, a teardrop in the Indian Ocean, invites exploration of its rich biodiversity. From lush rainforests with trumpeting elephants to sun-dappled savannas hosting elusive leopards, the island's natural beauty unfolds. Over 400 bird species paint the skies. Sustainable conservation efforts mirror the commitment to preserve wildlife and natural heritage. Join us on a captivating wildlife expedition through Sri Lanka's wilderness.

sections.title: Majestic Elephants
sections.description: Sri Lanka's elephants, a vital part of its culture and ecology, face challenges like habitat loss and human-elephant conflict. Revered for their wisdom and strength, these iconic creatures play a central role in religious ceremonies and festivals. Conservation efforts aim to protect them, ensuring a harmonious coexistence between humans and wildlife in Sri Lanka.

sections.title: Sri Lanka's Captivating Destinations
sections.description: Explore Sri Lanka's wonders, from the iconic Sigiriya Rock Fortress to Yala National Park. Visit Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, Galle Fort, and unwind on Bentota's pristine beaches. Immerse yourself in Polonnaruwa's cultural richness, marvel at Nuwara Eliya's scenic beauty, and discover the sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy. Embark on a diverse adventure in Sri Lanka!

sections.title: Sri Lanka's Unique Bird Ballet
sections.description: Explore the enchanting world of Sri Lanka's avian wonders, where over 400 species paint the skies with vibrant colors and melodies. Spotlighting a few:

list.name: Sri Lanka Junglefowl:
list.description: The national bird, known for its vibrant plumage and symbolic significance.

list.name: Sri Lanka Hanging Parrot:
list.description: Recognized for its brilliant green plumage and unique ability to sleep upside down.

list.name: Ceylon Blue Magpie:
list.description: Charismatic and endemic, distinguished by its striking blue and chestnut plumage.
